title: compromise methods
extract: A specific example of a compromise structure is the Contrasting Groups Method. The principal focus of judgment in the contrasting groups' method is on the competence of examinees rather than on the difficulty of a test or its items.
extract_html: A specific example of a compromise structure is the Contrasting Groups Method. The principal focus of judgment in the contrasting groups' method is on the competence of examinees rather than on the difficulty of a test or its items.
